position summary
serve as a resource to plan sponsors and financial advisors for matters related to erisa compliance, plan design and governmental reporting. this person is the single point of contact for employer, financial profession and plan sponsor for their accounts. a retirement plan consultant is able to handle client meetings both in person and via phone. this position serves as the retirement plan expert on testing, 5500, loans and distributions and understands plan design and can assist on plan operation and document updates.

join the people helping people.
for people drawn to serving others through their work, pscu is a place to thrive, as we serve our credit union members best by taking care of each other first.

if you want to help shape an industry, challenge yourself, and invest in your own future, this is the place for you. pscu is a highly accessible environment where you’re empowered to think on your feet, work from your heart, and discover the very best version of your professional and personal self. “our momentum. your moment.”

this application is the first step in seizing your moment.

this position provides financial services product expertise (e.g., debit, prepaid, credit, atm, contact center services & solutions, ecommerce, mobile, integration, emv/contactless, etc.) and will serve as the liaison between the solutions consulting team and all applicable areas of the company. the main focus of this role is to support our client-facing teams in the field by presenting pscu solutions to a financial institution audience. this position will collaborate with the card solutions team members, leadership, and support teams such as sales, account management, product, implementations, its, marketing, and analytics. this position works with these teams to build pscu’s market position by marshaling and coordinating both expertise and offerings to present outstanding solutions for pscu-owners and prospects.

essential functions & responsibilities

act as a subject matter expert for pscu’s comprehensive solution offerings and employ them to solve problems of fis.

act as a liaison between product, account management and sales to develop, deepen, and advance pscu’s account and business relationships.

collaborate with pscu support teams (e.g., its, product, implementations, marketing, and analytics) to support fi experience business units in general, and account management and sales teams in particular, to answer questions, prepare and deliver onsite presentations, and provide other marketing/sales support as needed to drive and close business and improve relationships.

serve as a resource for pscu sales and account management to address inquiries and educational opportunities pertaining to pscu solutions.

proactively pursue and stay up-to-date on competitive and product intelligence information, including major competitors, industry updates, product launches, and trends.

demonstrate sales savvy through active listening, intelligent questioning, and using internal and industry relationships to help sales and account management position solutions to pscu fis.

demonstrate sales savvy through the capacity to read the room, match the needs of the audience to the delivered content, and pivot conversations based on the needs of the fi.

build and lead a solution sales pipeline by collaborating with account management and reaching out directly to potential prospects (solution sales)

establish and maintain effective communication with prospective fis through appropriate contact channels; identify challenges throughout the sales/lifecycle process that need to be overcome in order to successfully implement a commitment.

achieve the year-end revenue target established at the beginning of the fiscal year as advised.

act as a problem-solving partner for pscu internal partners.

perform other duties as assigned.

position specifications

bachelor's degree in related field or equivalent combination of education and experience preferred.

seven (7) years experience in banking or credit union card processing with product line of business expertise required.

product training and demonstration experience required.

sales automation software experience preferred.

knowledge, skills, & abilities

excellence, innovation, leadership, passion, trust and diversity, equity, & inclusion

demonstrate ability to operate independently while keeping connected with many internal departments

act as the voice of product and provide sales support and positioning mentorship

possess strong interpersonal skills, build relationships and support the growth of the individual, the team, and the organization

lead with demos, be engaging and compelling and understand the fis reaction to all interactions

demonstrate solutions minded and persuasive approaches and optimally leverage pscu relationships to determine solutions

offer a broad depth of payments background and the ability to connect the individual fi needs to the bigger picture needs

demonstrates ability to present effectively virtually and in person

accept change and be flexible, responding to needed changes in the appropriate moment.

demonstrate ability to appeal to multiple layers of the organization

ability to identify the ae/sales/fi need and align pscu’s value to that need

ability to support all of pscu’s lines of business

ability to negotiate with and influence others

proficiency in relevant computer software applications

ability to travel as needed, 41% - 50%

ability to maintain the confidentiality of materials handled

pay equity

to $109,400.00
in addition this position is eligible for an incentive plan, based on performance.

job_title: Health Science - Full time Instructor - Anatomy and Physiology -
job_desc:
south college invites capable, energetic, outgoing, applicants who are focused on transforming the lives of our students! at south college, you will help implement our strategy of “where dreams find direction!” we are one of the nation’s fastest growing institutions of higher learning with over 6,000 students covering 7 campuses and online learning sites. we are also one of nation’s highest producers of licensed healthcare professionals and offer a myriad of undergraduate and graduate health and healthcare programs for our students.

south college online seeks candidates for a remote full-time faculty position in anatomy and physiology. successful candidates will have a terminal degree in a related field and preference will be given to candidates who have successfully taught anatomy and physiology in the online format. the position is online remote and will report directly to the department chair for health science online.

the anatomy and physiology faculty will teach twenty (20) college-level courses per year. responsibilities include, but are not limited to, facilitating discussions effectively, providing live and recorded lectures as necessary, and guiding virtual or at-home lab assignments.

the anatomy and physiology faculty will also facilitate discussions effectively, maintain student grade and attendance records for all courses taught, coordinate updates to the master course shell (blueprint) in canvas, maintain and update course syllabi, assist in choosing instructional materials, and supervise adjunct faculty teaching these courses online.

all faculty are required to participate in department activities, including committee meetings, curriculum discussion, student solutions management, and other service activities. additional duties may be assigned as needed.

requirements

applicants must have a terminal degree in a biological science with successful completion of a minimum of 18 hours of graduate coursework in directly related coursework including, but not limited to, biology, human anatomy, human physiology, biochemistry or other related courses. preference will be given to applicants with prior successful online teaching experience.

the opportunity
huron helps its clients drive growth, enhance performance and sustain leadership in the markets they serve. we collaborate with education organizations to develop strategies and implement solutions that enable the transformative change our clients need to own their future. together, we empower clients to drive innovation, create sustainable funding streams and deliver better student outcomes.

today, leaders of higher education institutions and academic medical centers are spending too much time reacting to market forces, rather than focusing on the essential priorities that help students, faculty and staff thrive. the most productive path forward requires an intentional approach and innovative thinking, whereby stakeholders across the entire institution rally around a shared vision and embrace the hard work of effecting change.

you’ll help our clients to achieve organizational effectiveness, improve student outcomes, implement new technologies and align resources and investments to ensure long-term sustainability.

join our team as the expert you are now and create your future.
an indispensable role… huron clients approach us with a unique set of challenges. our consultants play an integral client-facing project or work-stream leadership role. while activities vary based on project size/scope and individual skill-sets and strengths, the consultant can expect to spend their time follows: 80% will be allocated to material client interaction through all project phases, project management, intensive data-analysis and the identification of the “so-what’s” therein, and to creating compelling client-ready presentations and; 20% will be spent developing analysts and coachees when assigned, participating in practice development and, carrying out routine administrative tasks. everyone works in symphony to achieve a common objective: create and implement viable solutions. consultants gain valuable, hands-on consulting experience…and that translates to career growth.

begin your career with forward motion... huron prides itself on being a firm big enough to boast a global footprint…yet not too big to preserve our entrepreneurial spirit. this allows everyone to make an impact and gives you access to a multitude of career paths. we’re dedicated to helping you reach your true potential…so prepare for an exciting career!

management analyst 5 (ma5/pd)
71093136

this position supports innovative health care policy projects including the health care cost transparency board, universal health care commission, and cascade select public option through expert consultation, policy analysis, and creation of legislative and commission reports. this person analyzes data and trends in the health care market and systems for the purpose of long-term strategic planning for these programs. the ideal candidate will bring knowledge of health care systems and a desire to push forward the work of these programs that offer increased health care accessibility across the state.




the policy division (pd) of the health care authority (hca) is statutorily directed to study all state-purchased health care, alternative health care delivery systems and strategies for the procurement of health services, and to coordinate state agency efforts to develop and implement uniform policies across state purchased health care programs. pd serves as the focal point for coordinating the agency’s strategy, affordability, and health policy efforts. the division is structured to provide expert direction, consultation, and support for these activities. pd is responsible for driving policy design, development and implementation of health reform, and health transformation activities and program development and refinements for all programs.


the management analyst 5 (ma5) is responsible for a broad range of health care policy development activities related to innovative state-wide solutions to increase access, reduce cost, and reduce disparities. this position will report to the coverage and market strategies manager to guide, support, and coordinate the work of the health care cost transparency board and also provide support on projects such as cascade select public option, the universal health care commission, and other projects/programs in the pd.

the opportunity
huron helps its clients drive growth, enhance performance and sustain leadership in the markets they serve. we collaborate with education organizations to develop strategies and implement solutions that enable the transformative change our clients need to own their future. together, we empower clients to drive innovation, create sustainable funding streams and deliver better student outcomes.

today, leaders of higher education institutions and academic medical centers are spending too much time reacting to market forces, rather than focusing on the essential priorities that help students, faculty and staff thrive. the most productive path forward requires an intentional approach and innovative thinking, whereby stakeholders across the entire institution rally around a shared vision and embrace the hard work of effecting change.

you’ll help our clients to achieve organizational effectiveness, improve student outcomes, implement new technologies and align resources and investments to ensure long-term sustainability.

join our team as the expert you are now and create your future.
to succeed in a competitive environment, colleges and universities must improve the student experience. huron supports institutions with coordinated, scalable, strategic, student-centric approaches. we partner with clients to bring their student vision to life, using modern technologies that support effective recruitment and financial aid strategies, enrolled student experience tracking, referral integration and support interventions, and university advancement strategies. improving the student experience requires a holistic approach, including the effective implementation and adoption of a unified cloud-based technology system. huron’s comprehensive planning, implementation and post-production support services help institutions create a more seamless, personalized student experience.

consultants in the student lifecyle solutions practice assist clients with the planning and implementation of oracle student cloud & peoplesoft campus solutions software. in this role, consultants will work as a functional lead or a project manager in conjunction with other huron and client team members throughout the entire implementation lifecycle, including planning, configuration, design, build, conversion, training, go-live and post-production support.


preferred skills & experience
-excellent communication skills - oral and written - and the interpersonal skills needed quickly to establish relationships of trust and collaboration

job description

procore is looking for a senior value consultant, owners, to join our sales engineering team. in this role, you’ll serve as a key contributor in the cross-functional effort to create a value management program helping our customers and prospects understand, measure, and optimize their procore investment. you’ll introduce industry context, value drivers, and how procore’s product can be transformative to our customers’ and prospects’ business.
as a senior value consultant, owners, you’ll apply industry and vertical-specific knowledge to map trends to customer value drivers. you’ll create well-structured, visually appealing documents and presentations to reduce the sales cycle, solidify opportunities, and close deals. by investing time documenting best practices, capturing and disseminating knowledge, and conducting other initiatives, you’ll significantly enhance the value story across the business.

job_title: Senior Organizational Change Management Consultant - Workforce Benefits
job_desc:
job description:
pacific life is investing in bright, agile and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of building a $1bm revenue, profitable new business in the workforce benefits market. we’re actively seeking a talented senior organizational change management consultant to join our workforce benefits division in newport beach, ca. this is a fulltime role that is highly desirable to be on-site or hybrid in newport beach, ca. will consider 100% remote for the right candidate.

as a senior organizational change management (ocm) consultant, you’ll play a key role in pacific life’s growth and long-term success of our newest division, workforce benefits (wbd). your role will be important in ensuring projects (change efforts) meet objectives on time and on budget by increasing employee adoption and usage. the primary responsibility is creating and implementing change management strategies, plans and tactics that maximize employee adoption and usage, and minimize resistance. additionally, the ocm practitioner for wbd will also manage communication efforts within the division, with support from the corporate communications team. you will support the creation of onboarding and assimilation plan to ensure new team members are integrated quickly and efficiently, as well as assisting in adjacent disciplines where needed to support the success of the division.

this role reports to the head of strategy & pmo for the workforce benefits division, and will play an integral role in helping to ensure the division’s strategy is translated into people readiness for change.


consulting and coaching employee-facing roles of sponsors and managers, change-enabling roles of project managers and teams

applying a structured methodology and lead change management activities to engage stakeholders, customizing and scaling as appropriate based on feedback and assessments

supporting communication efforts; adapt communication to the culture of the organization in consult with corporate communications team and applicable hr business partners

coordinating efforts with project managers, project teams and smes; engage adjacent disciplines when/if appropriate

identifying and utilizing networks of key influencers to adoption

managing stakeholders; secure early and continual involvement of senior leaders

maintain confidentiality


8+ years of experience project management, hr, or training & development

4-year degree communication, human resources, business or equivalent experience

ccmp certification and/or prosci certification (preferred)


specialized depth and/or breadth of experience to serve as expert in own area, using best practices and knowledge of internal or external business issues to improve products or services.

apply functional knowledge and existing methodologies to solve complex problems and recommend best practices.

display a growth mindset to take a new perspective using existing solutions.

must be a self-starter, be well organized, effectively manage your time and be a strong leader who can adapt rapidly to new developments and changing priorities

work independently, receive minimal guidance, and act as a resource for colleagues with less experience.

job description:
pacific life is investing in bright, agile and diverse talent to contribute to our mission of innovating our business and creating a superior customer experience. we’re actively seeking a senior change management analyst to join our enterprise program office in newport beach, ca. this role can be on-site, hybrid, or 100% remote.

the change analyst plays a key role in ensuring projects and enterprise change initiatives meet organizational objectives by increasing employee adoption and usage. you will be responsible for all phases of the change management project including preparing, managing and reinforcing change until the change is operational. throughout the change project you will also be responsible for developing strategy and plans, conducting assessments, leading change activities, providing communications, analyzing gaps and developing tactics to remove barriers to adopting change. you will work collaboratively alongside the project manager and core project team, coordinating efforts, providing change management tasks/dates for integration into the overall project plan, and providing regular change management status updates for reporting.


possess and apply a broad knowledge of change management methodologies, practices and procedures that identify, analyze, and prepare risk mitigation tactics and manage anticipated resistance.

develop strategy and plans, conduct assessments, lead change activities, provide communications, analyze gaps and develop tactics to remove barriers to adopting change through the change management project.

work closely with the project manager and project teams to support training and communication efforts and integrate change management activities into the project plan

demonstrate proficiency in communications; adapt communication to the culture of the organization that reinforces a service-oriented culture that is consistent with our mission, vision, strategies, guiding principles, and overall company values

handle complex assignments with minimum supervision

support change management at the organizational level, coordinating efforts with the change management center of excellence, other change practitioners, change-enabling roles of project manager, project team and smes

create and execute on actionable deliverables for the five change management levers: communications plan, sponsor roadmap, coaching plan, training plan, resistance management plan

apply judgement and makes independent recommendations and/or decisions that may affect impacted groups

facilitate meetings – in-person, online or hybrid model (both)

coach and support people, managers, and executives through change transition


5+ years progressive experience in change management, hr management and/or management consulting

experience and knowledge of change management principles, methodologies, tools, and managing the people side of change as they transition through current to future state for enterprise organizational efforts

must possess excellent active listening and exceptional communication skills – both written and verbal; ability to clearly articulate messages and work effectively with a variety of audiences at all levels (e.g., developing communications in multiple communications mediums, such as emails, newsletters, websites, videos, and presentations will be required).

must be a self-starter, with ability to establish and maintain strong relationships, cultivates innovation, have demonstrated experience in a lead role, be well organized with a natural inclination for planning strategy and tactics, effectively manage their time and be a strong leader who can adapt rapidly to new developments, changing priorities and managing-through-influence with a propensity to persevere

a bachelor’s degree in communications, human resources, business administration or other relevant study, or equivalent experience in a relevant field such as pmo, training development or marketing, is foundational.

familiarity with project management approaches, tools, and phases of the project lifecycle.


change management certification or designation

certified change management professional and prosci certifications a plus

experience in the financial services industry

michael baker international is a leading provider of engineering, development, intelligence and technology solutions with global reach and mobility. the firm offers a comprehensive range of innovative services and solutions in support of federal, state, and municipal governments, foreign allied governments, and a wide range of private development and commercial clients. michael baker international’s focus is on the safety and security of people across the world through planning and engineering improvements to infrastructure and the environment, and through protection of our quality of life and freedom in support of national and international security. with more than $1 billion in annual revenue, michael baker international has more than 5,000 employees in over 80 offices located across the u.s. and internationally, and is ranked as the 26th largest design firm in the u.s. by engineering news record (enr). michael baker international’s mission is to make a difference by providing innovative solutions to sustain the future and further the safety, security and quality of life for people across the globe by providing the highest level of expertise, unmatched quality and effective project teams for a diverse range of projects and clients. michael baker international offers excellent benefit packages that includes: medical, dental, vision, disability insurance, life insurance, flexible spending accounts, additional paid time off, flex-time, 401-k retirement plan, tuition reimbursement and employee credit union. to learn more, please visit us on the web at www.mbakerintl.com . michael baker international is an eeo/affirmative action employer - m/f/disability/veteran/e-verify employer

who we are

michael baker international (michael baker) is a leading provider of architectural, engineering and consulting services, including design, planning, environmental, construction and program management. the company provides its comprehensive range of services and solutions to support u.s. federal, state, and municipal governments, foreign allied governments, and a wide range of commercial clients. michael baker’s more than 3,000 employees across nearly 100 locations are committed to a culture of innovation, collaboration and technological advancement to help solve challenges for clients and communities throughout the country. to learn more, visit https://mbakerintl.com/ .

summary

michael baker is a national leader in technology solutions supporting clients in local, regional, state, and national government to solve complex problems with advanced technologies for the 21st century. this position would be directly supporting the firm’s nationwide broadband planning and implementation work performed within michael baker’s consulting and technology solutions (cts) team, which includes geospatial information technology (git) and gis; datamark, the public safety gis arm of michael baker; light detection and ranging (lidar); unmanned aerial systems (uas) and pavement technologies. the cts team is comprised of nearly 200 technology experts focusing on technology differentiation and innovation to support michael baker’s growth initiatives.

michael baker’s broadband initiative offers a balanced mix of technical expertise along with project experience applying innovative technologies and processes to complex projects with government clients and in the private sector. our broadband team has substantial experience in broadband planning, program management, mapping, and data verification on numerous statewide broadband projects. we also provide technical support and consulting services for broadband planning and program management to clients at various local, regional, statewide, and national levels. our broadband team is seeking an enthusiastic and motivated gis specialist for its fast-growing cts team to play a critical role helping to manage and execute broadband projects. articulate, concise and consistent communication is essential for working with leadership and with project staff to outline workplans, assign duties, responsibilities, and quality control.

essential duties and responsibilities

work directly with the broadband project managers and technical managers and assist in various aspects on numerous broadband projects.

self-starter and able to manage multiple tasks concurrently, and d elegate tasks on the project to employees best positioned to complete them and monitor their progress.

direct and coordinate activities of gis personnel to ensure the tasks progress correctly and on schedule.

provide feedback and recommendations from clients to the broadband team to continually advance and progress its suite of broadband planning and mapping applications.

performs quality control procedures on deliverables.

performs complex analysis to support project objectives. provides technical guidance to client or other project personnel

prepares and presents technical and program information to team members, management, and clients

assist with proposal development and new work added research

qualifications

experience in broadband mapping, fiber network design, census mapping, and knowledge of datasets related to telecom and broadband planning

possess a proficient understanding of gis and esri technology

proven experience with arcmap, arcgis pro, arcgis online, and arcgis dashboards.

experience in administering / configuring / implementing / customizing portal and/or arcgis online

experience having successfully served as a gis task lead with minimal oversight, and a proven ability to prioritize multiple tasks while meeting deadlines.

other essential skills include creative problem-solving, organizational skills, and a solid understanding of broadband projects, processes, and execution.

the ability to work both independently and collaboratively with teams across the nation is essential.

self-motivated to stay informed on geospatial technology advancements and desire to learn cross discipline skill sets.

strong written and verbal communications skills are essential – able to verbally present gis practices, concepts, and custom software to clients and potential clients

proven work history, strong work ethic and team-player attitude

gisp preferred but not required

required education & experience

8+ years related and relevant experience

four-year or advanced degree in geography, gis, public safety, engineering, planning, computer science or related field.

workplace flexibility

remote working is allowable within the lower 48 states. eastern time zone is preferred but not required.

minimal travel is expected – less than 10%.

salary

the range for this role is $70,000-$105,000. this will be dependent on the skills of the incoming candidate.

worldstrides is the global leader in educational travel and experiential learning. the company was founded over 50 years agoand has grown to provide a wide range of programs for more than 550,000 students annually from more than 5,000 k12 schools and universities to over 100 countries around the world. worldstrides offers experiential learning programs in educational travel, performing arts, language immersion, career exploration, service-learning, study abroad, and sports. each of these experiences helps students to see beyond the classroom and to see the world – and themselves – in new ways.

the team member care team lead is a key member of the envision by worldstrides team that is responsible for ensuring that full time and seasonal team members that join our team feel supported and prepared for their role. they will define and implement processes and systems to create effective and efficient communication, as well as serve as a hub within the organization for resources, knowledge sharing, and inclusion. this role will support new employee onboarding, track employee progress, and manage communications with team members, supervisors, and human resources. the ideal candidate for this role feels extreme satisfaction by helping others feel supported in their work, genuinely cares about individual employee progress, and understands the value of long-term investment in team growth and development.

at worldstrides, the experience is everything. by joining our team you help provide moments that delight and open up the world of learning. our team is truly passionate about making each experience a once in a lifetime opportunity for each traveler that is easy to manage from a to z. each journey is different, which is why we offer a broad range of experiential learning programs for groups and individuals of all ages throughout their lifelong learning journey.

who we are & why we are different
panoramic health partners with nephrology practices to implement value-based care (vbc). vbc prioritizes high-touch care coordination for patients with chronic illnesses like chronic kidney disease (ckd). it is an interdisciplinary model where care is developed and perfected with the health of the patient as the primary driver of success. for patients living with ckd, that means slowing the progression of the disease, reducing hospitalizations, and focusing on home dialysis treatment therapies and transplantation if a diagnosis of end stage renal disease occurs.

job_title: District Court Law Clerk, Itasca County, Honorable Sarah McBroom
job_desc:
the honorable sarah mcbroom, chambered in itasca county, grand rapids, minnesota, seeks qualified candidates for a judicial law clerk position. this position is in the law clerk classification. a judicial law clerk position offers the opportunity to work within the minnesota judicial branch at the trial court level, and gain insight into judicial and court processes, with a court perspective on the administration of justice. judicial law clerks work directly with a district court judge performing legal research and drafting memoranda and orders.

this position has the option to work on-site, fully remote, or in a hybrid environment.

the law clerk and judge have a close working relationship that affords the clerk an opportunity to observe how judges reason and arrive at decisions. a law clerk can expect a comprehensive experience in many facets of the law.

view our interactive video, "working for the minnesota judicial branch" , for a look into being a judicial branch employee.

job_desc:
executive division – new york city
legal aide for reproductive justice
reference no. exec_nyc_pls_2022

application deadline is december 21, 2022
paid, part-time placement for full-time law students

the new york state office of the attorney general’s (oag) executive division is seeking applications from law students
for a paid, part-time placement. the selected student will be hired as a legal aide and work directly with the special
counsel for reproductive justice to support the oag’s efforts in litigation, legislative work, policy advocacy, and public
education in the rapidly evolving legal landscape following the supreme court’s reversal of


since the supreme court’s decision was first leaked, the attorney general has redoubled her efforts to protect and
secure abortion rights and access in new york state. the special counsel position was created to have a cross-
disciplinary focus that involves working collaboratively with numerous bureaus, including health care, civil rights,
internet and technology and appeals & opinions. the legal aide will assist with research projects in areas such as risk
analysis for clinics, health care providers, abortion funds, and other institutions; digital privacy of sensitive health
information; analysis in preparation for future affirmative and defensive litigation under new york’s newly enacted laws
safeguarding reproductive rights; and analysis of potential or existing legislative proposals to further strengthen new
york’s laws in this area. the selected student will support the oag’s ongoing efforts in these critical areas while having
the opportunity to develop their legal research and writing skills and work directly with attorneys, support staff and
other professionals.




o cite-checking, formatting and proofreading briefs and other documents;
o conducting searches using westlaw or lexis;
o creating tables of contents and tables of authority; and
o assisting with submitting filings.

job description:
one of fortune’s best places to work, perkins coie llp, a leading international law firm, is seeking junior patent litigation associates to join our seattle, austin, chicago, madison, palo alto, san diego, san francisco, new york, denver, or washington, dc offices. we’ve created a firm culture that is based on collaboration, dedication to serving our clients, and mutual respect.
we are seeking junior associates to join our nationally ranked patent litigation group. candidates must have excellent academic credentials from a top tier law school and two years of experience litigating all aspects of patent disputes. ideal candidates will have an electrical engineering or computer science degree. additionally, we are seeking candidates with experience handling cases involving wireless technologies and practical work experience with wireless technologies including 802.11, 802.16 and/or 3gpp. admission to the patent bar is preferred. please access the link below to submit a cover letter, resume, law school transcript, undergraduate/graduate transcript(s) and a writing sample.
for candidates who have at least three years of legal experience in patent litigation, we will consider candidates who are interested in a fully remote arrangement for the wireless role. if you would like to be considered for a fully remote arrangement, please apply to the office located closest to your preferred remote location and indicate your interest in working remotely as well as your preferred remote work city and state in your cover letter. please understand that a remote arrangement may not be available in all states and the specific remote work location is subject to approval by perkins coie.

we invite you to explore the potential of being part of something clearly essential!
compass minerals (nyse: cmp) is a leading global provider of essential minerals focused on safely delivering where and when it matters to help solve nature’s challenges for customers and communities. the company’s salt products help keep roadways safe during winter weather and are used in numerous other consumer, industrial, chemical and agricultural applications. its plant nutrition products help improve the quality and yield of crops, while supporting sustainable agriculture. additionally, the company is pursuing development of a sustainable lithium brine resource to support the north american battery market and is a minority owner of fortress north america, a next-generation fire retardant company. compass minerals operates 12 production and packaging facilities with nearly 2,000 employees throughout the u.s., canada and the u.k. visit compassminerals.com for more information about the company and its products.

contracts attorney
ardent mills is searching for a highly motivated, passionate lawyer to join our in-house legal team as a contracts attorney. this person will be exposed to a variety of routine to moderately complex commercial contract matters that pertain to the organization and will work under the direction of the general counsel, senior counsel, labor and employment counsel, corporate counsel, and in collaboration with the associate corporate counsel and legal admin.
as contracts attorney, you will work directly with the law team to review, draft, and negotiate contracts for the assigned areas of the business, provide support to the legal operations of the department, including maintaining contract documentation within our electronic contract system and coordinating final signatures. in this role, you will leverage the established legal department forms, templates, playbooks, and processes to review and draft non-contracts, negotiate third-party contracts, track legal matters and trends, and help establish contract playbooks and new templates.
the in-house legal team at ardent mills practices under a philosophy that “no” is rarely the correct answer. we strive to help the business find solutions to meet their goals while minimizing risk to ardent mills. we do so by understanding our business, connecting and relating to people, diversifying both our business and legal knowledge base, and remaining agile to adapt to different situations. to accomplish these goals, candidates should have a strong understanding of business, strong team collaboration skills, excellent communication skills, a practical, solutions-oriented approach, and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. additionally, success in this role will come with strong knowledge of various contracts and contractual issues and creative thinking to find ways to legally navigate potential impediments to business objectives. the contracts attorney will be expected to demonstrate an uncompromising level of trust and operate with integrity and in alignment with ardent mills values at all times.

cno financial group’s legal department is hiring an assistant general counsel to autonomously provide a full range of legal advice and services in one or more specialized practice areas – including, but not limited to product development, marketing/sales, claims/underwriting/phs, labor & employment, agent conduct, privacy, intellectual property, product management, information technology, and/or litigation management - across a major insurance segment of the enterprise.
this is your opportunity to lead and direct the legal or compliance review of respective enterprise-wide area (product development, sales/marketing, product management) for a major insurance segment. this role is intended to provide a succession plan for an associate general counsel.
as an assistant general counsel, your responsibilities will include:
providing legal counsel, compliance guidance and interpretations of complex federal & state laws to support new insurance product development, new life & health insurance product advertising, insurance product management, sales and marketing, and electronic transactions.

confluent is pioneering a fundamentally new category of data infrastructure focused on data in motion. have you ever found a new favorite series on netflix, picked up groceries curbside at walmart, or paid for something using square? that’s the power of data in motion in action—giving organizations instant access to the massive amounts of data that is constantly flowing throughout their business. at confluent, we’re building the foundational platform for this new paradigm of data infrastructure. our cloud-native offering is designed to be the intelligent connective tissue enabling real-time data, from multiple sources, to constantly stream across the organization. with confluent, organizations can create a central nervous system to innovate and win in a digital-first world.

we’re looking for self-motivated team members who crave a challenge and feel energized to roll up their sleeves and help realize confluent’s enormous potential. chart your own path and take healthy risks as we solve big problems together. we value having diverse teams and want you to grow as we grow—whether you’re just starting out in your career or managing a large team, you’ll be amazed at the magnitude of your impact.

job_title: VP, Associate General Counsel - Employment & Litigation
job_desc:
overview

frontdoor, inc. (nasdaq: ftdr) is a company that’s obsessed with taking the hassle out of owning a home. with services powered by people and enabled by technology, it is the parent company of four home service plan brands: american home shield, hsa, landmark and oneguard, as well as proconnect, an on-demand membership service for home repairs and maintenance, and streem, a technology company that enables businesses to serve customers through an enhanced augmented reality, computer vision and machine learning platform. frontdoor serves 2.2 million customers across the u.s. through a network of approximately 17,000 pre-qualified contractor firms that employ an estimated 60,000 technicians. the company’s customizable home service plans help customers protect and maintain their homes from costly and unexpected breakdowns of essential home systems and appliances. with 50 years of home services experience, the company responds to over four million service requests annually. for more details, visit frontdoorhome.com

responsibilities

(this is a fully remote role.)


frontdoor seeks a talented, energetic, innovative and self‐motivated attorney with ~12-15 years of relevant legal experience to serve as vice president, associate general counsel – employment and litigation. this position will report directly to the senior vice president, general counsel & corporate secretary of frontdoor and will be the lead legal team member responsible for handling all hr and employment related matters pertaining to our business operations, as well as advising and overseeing litigation matters and disputes more generally. this role requires a person to possess a strong analytical mindset, coupled with a strong employment and litigation background. the ideal candidate will have a practical, business-oriented approach to problem-solving, tempered by an appreciation of legal complexity and risk.


a successful candidate will also be energized and excited by our house rules. if you identify withour house rules we would welcome the opportunity to meet you!

obsess over our customers’ problems - we wake up every day and obsess about how to remove the hassle out of our customers’ lives. we start with the customer and work backwards.

be an owner, not a renter - we own our actions, and don’t make excuses or accept them. we’re good stewards of our energy and resources. we set high standards and hold ourselves and each other accountable.

be transparent, build trust - transparency builds trust, where strong teams and great ideas are born and freely shared. we treat others with respect and win together. we check egos at the door, and have no place for politics or personal agendas.

do great things every day - we give our best and work with integrity and purpose. we believe a diversity of people, talent and ideas makes us stronger. we’re inquisitive and innovative, never satisfied with the status quo. we solve problems, make lives better, and enjoy what we do.


providing high quality legal advice and counsel in a timely fashion to the general counsel, other legal team members and business partners on hr and employment issues pertaining to the operations and continued growth and expansion of our home service plan business and related businesses.

providing lead legal support to people team regarding employment and labor-related matters, which may include employee relations issues, policy development, and employee benefit plan compliance.

assuring company compliance with federal, state and local labor and employment laws including the fair labor standards act, state and local wage and hour laws, the americans with disabilities act, the occupational safety and health act, the family medical leave act, title vii, and erisa.

overseeing and handling the company’s response in various dispute proceedings including federal and state litigation matters and administrative proceedings before the eeoc and state human rights agencies.

assisting as needed on labor and employment issues for the company’s international operations.

overseeing and managing the company’s response in various consumer and commercial disputes proceedings including federal and state litigation matters and aaa arbitrations.

identifying and analyzing legal issues, and effectively communicating sound, understandable legal recommendations to the appropriate business team members.

actively participating in a collaborative manner in cross-functional business teams to identify, evaluate, and resolve complex business issues and risks.

ensuring compliance with legal requirements and company policies generally applicable to the company’s business.

willingness to handle other projects and matters as may be assigned from time to time.

working with and supervising outside counsel on various legal matters as appropriate.

qualifications


j.d possessing significant employment and litigation expertise, with ~12-15 years of relevant experience within a law firm and/or in-house legal department;

expertise operating in a complex regulatory environment and/or an innovative or rapidly-growing company or similar business venture, is strongly preferred;

top academic record and large firm experience strongly preferred;

experience with supporting a home service plan business or customer service operations is a strong plus;

strong business acumen;

creative problem solver with customer focus and “can do” attitude;

self-starter who will initiate projects and anticipate needs before they become critical;

ability to multi-task with a sense of urgency and ability to meet deadlines within a changing, fast‐paced environment;

strategic thinker with a solutions orientation;

team player with strong interpersonal skills;

excellent communication and presentation skills;

proven history of developing cross‐functional relationships with all levels of an organization and functional expertise;

able to easily build rapport and the gain the confidence and respect of peers and senior leaders;

demonstrated ability to handle difficult issues in a professional, assertive and proactive manner; and

good standing in a state bar with the ability to join the tennessee bar as in-house counsel.


remote, but willingness to travel to business locations as required.

company_name: California Department of Housing and Community Development
job_desc:
job
job duties

under the general supervision of the assistant chief counsel, the incumbent in this position will primarily serve the department’s business and contract services branch (bcsb) and information technology branch (itb) with legal issues involving state contracting and procurement. the incumbent will advise these various divisions, and others, and will assist the office of the attorney general in representing the department in civil litigation. the incumbent will also work with the department of general services (dgs) in the handling of contracts and the intake of government claims under the government claims act. this position requires significant independence and skills and knowledge in handling contracts and civil litigation.

desirables

knowledge of procurement, contracts, contract solicitations, amendments, state and federal funding documents, licenses, data use agreements, non-disclosure agreements, bid protests.
working knowledge of sam, scm, government code related to contracting and other laws and regulations/policies to ensure compliance.
experience gathering discovery for litigation support, experience with voluminous records requests, experience with the government claims act.
knowledge and experience with the california public records act, foia and ipa.
knowledge of rulemaking procedures
demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, challenging work environment requiring quick turnarounds to meet established deadlines.
demonstrated analytical skills, including the ability to use good judgment when analyzing data and situations, draw sound conclusions, and take effective action.
working knowledge of legal documents and related material.
excellent oral and written communication skills and the ability to interact with individuals in different professional roles and at different levels.
ability to handle multiple assignments with accuracy, to prioritize work, meet deadlines and to work effectively, independently, or in a team environment.
demonstrated proficiency in using microsoft word, excel and outlook.
experience using e-document discovery software such as westlaw, lexis/nexis, etc.

essential functions

contract review. reviews, analyzes, and advises on the more complex and sensitive matters that arise within the functional responsibility of the department’s business and contract services branch (bcsb) and the department’s information technology branch (itb) relating to procurement documents, contracts, contract solicitations, amendments, state and federal funding documents, licenses, data use agreements, non-disclosure agreements, bid protests and other similar documents (collectively hereinafter “documents”) supporting department business functions. ensures that documents are administered and managed in accordance with applicable policies and procedures of the department, the state administrative manual (sam), state contracting manuals (scms), the california government code (gc), other applicable state and federal laws, regulations, policies and other legal requirements to ensure legal compliance by the department programs and other state agencies. assesses day-to-day operations for contract compliance and assists in the review and drafting of correspondence with contractors and other state entities.

litigation. provides litigation and discovery support to the attorney general's office legal staff to assess potential legal issues involving service contracts, bids, procurements, bid protests and other litigation matters. assists the attorney general’s office and bcsb with strategic planning to avoid litigation, reviews and responds to discovery, interpretation of statutes, regulations, policies and procedures regarding the department’s authority, role, and responsibilities.

legal research and writing. coordinates with bcsb and the department of general services (dgs) regarding legal issues involving service contracts, bids, procurements, bid protests and other similar documents. performs legal research, analysis, and prepares written formal and informal legal opinions, legal documents, and policy positions. prepares responses to inquiries from bcsb, dgs, and executive staff.

government claims. independently reviews, analyzes and, where applicable, prepares responses to government claims, and other similar documents. coordinates with bcsb, dgs, other hcd divisions and attorneys that support those divisions, and the attorney general’s office, when necessary, regarding government claims and other similar documents as it relates to ongoing and potential litigation risk and strategic planning. provides legal advice and counsel to department officials in a timely manner, consistent with the law and department policy

public records. serve as one of the lead attorneys for public record act requests, handling sensitive requests related to contracts and other records, providing a second level of review of front-line attorney work, and serving as liaison with external agencies.

bid protests. coordinates with and provide legal support to bcsb over bid protests by reviewing contract solicitations documents and briefs of interested parties to assist bcsb’s duty to provide timely decisions and compliance with applicable laws and regulations.

other job-related duties as appropriate.

the data analyst (da) manager requires a deep and broad appreciation for what is possible and what will soon be possible by taking full advantage of data. working with business and it solutions leaders, architecture, data scientist, business analysts, interface analyst, and engineers to drive the definition and implementation data driven and analytics solutions, platforms, and services encompassing data critical to the business, meta data, reference data, and master data, in support of data governance, data quality, to support and operationalize data science and/or business intelligence, to deliver and realize solutions in alignment with brighthouse financials' data & analytics strategy.
the da manager will manage a team who performs data profiling and assessments to interpret data and analyze results using statistical techniques to provide ongoing informational, descriptive, and diagnostic evaluations and data stories. the da manager will support training new and existing associates in identifying, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets. the da manager will work with management to prioritize business and information needs. as needed, the da manager may develop requirements, data definition, flow, mappings and lineage, and specifications to model and implement data collection, optimization, and delivery solutions, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality.


conduct full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design.


the da manager should demonstrate proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst, applied knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets and strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

in addition, strong working knowledge, experience, or technical expertise with data design and modeling, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques, reporting, databases, programming will be considered as a plus.

position responsibilities:
the program coordinator for the bronx healthy start partnership-albert einstein college of medicine will work to ensure quality and integrity of the implementation of the healthy start program and its various initiatives and required data collection and reporting, and community and stakeholder engagement. the incumbent will have the ability to provide leadership, work on initiatives to support the mch benchmarks, and other efforts that will grow and strengthen the partner network. knowledge is required of maternal-infant health, infant and child development, prenatal and postpartum care, parent-child interactions and relationships, services for the 0-3 age population, and the dynamics of child abuse and neglect; and experience with reflective practice and with health and social services that embrace the concepts of family-centered and strength-based service provision to culturally diverse communities/families. the coordinator works closely with all healthy start professional and support staff and identifies barriers and develops plans for corrective action where healthy start benchmarks are not met.

the bronx healthy start partnership is an initiative to eliminate disparities in perinatal health. this program is grant funded by the federal health services and services administration’s maternal and child health bureau’s division of healthy start and perinatal services. this national program aims to address the following goals: a) reduce infant mortality and adverse perinatal outcomes and disparities by 1) improving women’s health, 2) promoting quality services, 3) strengthening family resilience, 4) achieving collective impact. 5) increasing accountability through quality improvement, performance monitoring, and evaluation. therefore, our sub-contractors will focus on a) efforts to improve the health of women before, during, and after pregnancy; b) outreach and enrollment in health insurance coverage; c) coordination and facilitation of access to health care services; d) removing barriers and support for prevention, including clinical preventive services, inter-conceptional health, and health promotion; e) assistance with reproductive life planning; and f) focusing on prevention and health promotion (e.g. breastfeeding, immunization, safe sleep, family planning, smoking cessation, and use of the evidence-based, standardized curricula, ).

as a not-for-profit organization, mass general brigham is committed to supporting patient care, research, teaching, and service to the community by leading innovation across our system. founded by brigham and women’s hospital and massachusetts general hospital, mgb supports a complete continuum of care including community and specialty hospitals, a managed care organization, a physician network, community health centers, home care and other health-related entities. several of our hospitals are teaching affiliates of harvard medical school, and our system is a national leader in biomedical research.

our employees use the mass general brigham values to govern decisions, actions and behaviors. these values guide how we get our work done: patients, affordability, accountability & service commitment, decisiveness, innovation & thoughtful risk; and how we treat each other: diversity & inclusion, integrity & respect, learning, continuous improvement & personal growth, teamwork & collaboration.

join aledade as a practice transformation specialist (pts) and personally make an impact on patient care. as a pts you will make frequent visits to your assigned group of practices in order to assist the physicians and staff with practice transformation plans to shift into value-based care.

being a pts means you help practices by being a project manager for workflows, clinical calls, and workgroup participation, driving toward outcomes in the practice that improve care and reduce costs. the clinic will depend on the pts to keep initiatives organized and track goal performance. as a pts you will partner with your practices to help design, deploy, and train staff on workflows to incorporate the aledade technology into their daily activities. the mission is to change the landscape of healthcare delivery for that practice.
it is a role that demands a solid foundational understanding of the healthcare delivery system for primary care practices, clinical plus administrative experience, and exceptional change management skills. a variety of professionals can be a successful pts, including registered nurses, staff nurses, case managers, social workers, office managers, office support staff including billing and coding within hospitals, ambulatory care, skilled nursing facilities, home care, long term care or institutional facilities. a successful pts is passionate about population health, and highly mission oriented around providing better care to patients while reducing costs. at aledade, a pts can impact the health of their community by transforming one practice at a time. it is a job for the healthcare professional who wants to make a difference beyond the bedside, office or facility setting.

day to day:

join aledade as a practice transformation specialist (pts) and personally make an impact on patient care. as a pts you will make frequent visits to your assigned group of practices in order to assist the physicians and staff with practice transformation plans to shift into value-based care.

being a pts means you help practices by being a project manager for workflows, clinical calls, and workgroup participation, driving toward outcomes in the practice that improve care and reduce costs. the clinic will depend on the pts to keep initiatives organized and track goal performance. as a pts you will partner with your practices to help design, deploy, and train staff on workflows to incorporate the aledade technology into their daily activities. the mission is to change the landscape of healthcare delivery for that practice.
it is a role that demands a solid foundational understanding of the healthcare delivery system for primary care practices, clinical plus administrative experience, and exceptional change management skills. a variety of professionals can be a successful pts, including registered nurses, staff nurses, case managers, social workers, office managers, office support staff including billing and coding within hospitals, ambulatory care, skilled nursing facilities, home care, long term care or institutional facilities. a successful pts is passionate about population health, and highly mission oriented around providing better care to patients while reducing costs. at aledade, a pts can impact the health of their community by transforming one practice at a time. it is a job for the healthcare professional who wants to make a difference beyond the bedside, office or facility setting.

overview:
at ads, no idea is off limits, and we celebrate creativity and bold moves. for more than 50 years ads has been manufacturing a variety of innovative and environmentally friendly alternatives to traditional materials. headquartered in hilliard, ohio, we are a multi-billion dollar stormwater management company, manufacturing pipe and ancillary products. what does that mean? when it storms, we capture rain with our drain basins, convey it with pipe, store it using chambers and finally treat it with our water quality products, before safely returning water back to the environment. we handle, what we call, the entire lifecycle of a raindrop. our products help prevent flooding, which increases quality of life for people living in large cities, suburbs, and rural towns. we also believe in creating a circular economy and are the largest plastic recycling company in north america. we use plastic shampoo and detergent bottles to create pipe, diverting over 500 million pounds of plastic from landfills every year. ads operates a global network of over 60 manufacturing plants and 30 distribution centers.

we have amazing stories to tell, and we need your help getting our story out there. to learn more about ads, please visit our website at www.adspipe.com.

wherever drivers go, we're leading the way. agero's mission is to rethink the vehicle ownership experience through a powerful combination of passionate people and data-driven technology, strengthening our clients' relationships with their customers. as the #1 b2b, white-label provider of digital driver assistance services, we're pushing the industry in a new direction, taking manual processes, and redefining them as digital, transparent, and connected. this includes: an industry-leading dispatch management platform powered by swoop; comprehensive accident management services; knowledgeable consumer affairs and connected vehicle capabilities; and a growing marketplace of services, discounts and support enabled by a robust partner ecosystem. the company has over 150 million vehicle coverage points in partnership with leading automobile manufacturers, insurance carriers and many others. managing one of the largest national networks of service providers, agero responds to approximately 12 million service events annually. agero, a member company of the cross country group, is headquartered in medford, mass., with operations throughout north america. to learn more, visit www.agero.com.

at children’s wisconsin, we believe kids deserve the best.

we offer a wide variety of rewarding career opportunities and are seeking individuals dedicated to helping us achieve our vision of the healthiest kids in the country. if you want to work for an organization that makes a difference for children and families, and encourages you to be at your best every day, please apply today.

who we are and what we do
deel is a global team that helps businesses hire anyone, anywhere, easily. deel consists of more than a thousand self-driven individuals spanning over 75 countries. our unified yet diverse culture keeps us continually learning and innovating the deel platform and our products for customers.
companies should be able to hire the best talent anywhere in the world, so we are building the best platform to make that a reality. our market-leading technology, expertise, and global team are crucial to the success of deel’s platform. we deliver the best products and platform features in our space, enabling millions of jobs worldwide and connecting the global workforce with the best companies and opportunities.
why should you be part of deel's success story?
a 30-mile hiring radius should no longer dictate how companies hire because great talent lives everywhere. deel sees a world without hiring borders and endless talent that pairs perfect candidates with great companies.

the custom orders department manages account profiles and order processing for accounts whose requirements fall outside our normal order fulfillment procedures. our mission is to process orders accurately and efficiently according to the customer’s specific requirements. the custom orders department manages orders and account profiles for 400+ customers – each with its own unique set of requirements.

the custom orders coordinator supports the daily functions of the department in preparing orders for processing and in monitoring the progress of the orders through shipment. a typical workload for a coordinator carries an average of 100 active or pending orders depending on seasonality.

about bdp international:
bdp international is a privately held, family-owned non-asset based global logistics provider with annual sales exceeding $2.1 billion usd. founded in 1966 by richard bolte sr. and based in philadelphia, pennsylvania, bdp has grown to be one of the largest logistics providers in the world. bdp employs more than 4,000 people worldwide, and operates freight logistics centers in 270 cities across the world through a global network of wholly owned offices, joint ventures and affiliates in 135 countries.
the company serves more than 4,000 customers worldwide. clients include bayer, dow, dupont, heineken usa, honeywell, johnson & johnson, revlon, trek bicycle, wacker, and others.

lifeway's inventory management team is seeking an inventory analyst. this is not a traditional cycle counting and bin replenishment position. in this position, you'll provide inventory analysis and insight using your strong technical skills and business intelligence tools to help advance lifeway’s mission by providing leadership and expertise in the areas of: analyzing inventory levels compared to sales, recommending replenishment quantities and timing, and developing, tracking, and reporting inventory metrics that ensure industry best turns while minimizing stock outs.

why lifeway?

this is a place where you can bring your faith and work experience to join in the most important mission in the world: making disciples of jesus christ. whether you’re a creator or storyteller, data guru or problem-solver, or anywhere in between, if you’re passionate about serving the church, we have a place for you. lifeway has a strong work from anywhere (wfa) culture that is deeply focused on our mission and values. while headquartered in nashville, tn, many of our positions are remote-eligible and have autonomy and flexibility with work hours. we provide equipment and resources to ensure team members have access to a productive and ergonomic workspace. full-time employees are eligible for enrollment in our comprehensive benefits plans including healthcare, vacation and sick time, holiday pay, care days, 401(k) plan, maternity and paternity leave, adoption assistance, mission trip time, and more.
